Class Fraction

  • java.lang.Object
    • Fraction

  • public class Fraction
extends java.lang.Object
    Fraction This class implements the Fraction data type; that is, a rational number that can be written in the form p/q, where p and q are integers, with q <> 0 The implementation is done by immutable objects INV: The fractional is represented irreducibly.
    Author:
    ESCUELA

      • Fraction

        public Fraction(int integer,
                int numerator,
                int denominator)
        Create a fraction, from its mixed representation. The number created is mixedInteger + mixednumerator/mixeddenominator
        Parameters:
        integer - the integer part of the number
        numerator - the numerator of the fractional part
        denominator - the denominator of the fractional part. denominator!=0

    • Method Detail

      • denominator

        public int denominator()
        Return the denominator of the simplified fraction A fractional p/q is written in simplified form if q is a positive integer and The greatest common divisor of p and q is 1.
        Returns:
        The denominator of the simplified fraction
